properties.name: Banaras
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyIndiaBanaras is a holy city of pilgrimage where many Hindus bathe in the Ganaga River as a form of spiritual purification.

properties.name: Bodh-Gaya
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyBodh-Gaya, IndiaBodh-Gaya is the city in which Siddharth Gautama (the Buddha) is believed to have attained enlightenment while sitting under a bodhi tree. It is the most important pilgrimage site pertaining to the Buddha\'s life. At the Mahabodhi Temple there is a tree that was grown from the sappling of a sappling of the very bodhi tree Gautama sat under.

properties.name: Israel
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyLocation

properties.name: Japan
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyNaraNara, Japan houses six Buddhist temples, a Shinto shrine, and is the home of the Imperial Palace (Heijo Palace). According to Shinto tradition, the Imperial family is directly descended from the sun goddess Amaterasu.

properties.name: Jerusalem, Israel
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyJudaism\'s holiest city and Islam\'s third, this is the former site of Solomon\'s Temple and where Muhammad is believed to have ascended into Heaven.

properties.name: Jerusalem, Israel
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyLocationJudaism\'s holiest city and Islam\'s third. This is the former site of Solomon\'s Temple and where Muhammud supposedly ascended into Heaven.

properties.name: Mecca
properties.description: Posted by McmurphymeccaMecca contains the holiest site of Islam, the Masjid al-Haram. It is the largest mosque in the world. Inside is a massive black box called the kaaba. The kaaba contains a black stone that is believed by Muslims to have been given to Muhammad by the Archangel Gabriel. Muslims face towards this each day in prayer. All able Muslims are required to visit Mecca at least once before they die.

properties.name: Medina
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyLocation

properties.name: Medina
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyMedina is the second holiest city of Islam and is the burial place of Muhammad.

properties.name: Nara
properties.description: Posted by Mcmurphynara japanNara Japan houses six Buddhist temples, a Shinto shrine, and is the home of the Imperial Palace (Heijo Palace). According to Shinto tradition, the Imperial family is directly descended from the sun goddess Amaterasu.

properties.name: Nazareth
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyIsraelNazareth is the capital city of the Northern district of Israel and is believed by Christians to be the birthplace of Yeshua Ben Yoseph (Jesus). Nazareth serves as the Arab capital of Israel, since the majority of its inhabitants are Arabic.

properties.name: Qufu
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyChinaQufu is the legendary birthplace of Confucius. In Qufu, there is the Temple of Confucius, the Cemetery of Confucius, and the Kong Family Mansion.

properties.name: Rome, Italy
properties.description: Posted by McmurphyRome, ItalyVatican City is an enclave of Rome. 1 out of every 6 people in the world is Roman Catholic. The Pope\'s Apostolic Palace is in the Vatican, along with St. Peter\'s Basilica. The Basilica of St. John Lateran is the Pope\'s cathedral and is the acting Cathedral of Rome.

properties.name: Salt Lake City, Utah
properties.description: Posted by McmurphySalt Lake City, UtahSalt Lake City is home to Salt Lake Temple. Salt Lake Temple is the sixth temple built by the Church of Latter-Day Saints. This is considered a sacred temple by the Church and its members (Mormons).
